revisions.rev:
{{italic title}} {{See Wiktionary|the album by Tokio Hotel}} {{Infobox album | Name = Schrei | Type = studio | Artist = [[Tokio Hotel]] | Cover = Tokio_Hotel-Schrei-album.jpg | Released = September 19, 2005 | Recorded = 2004/2005 | Genre = [[Alternative rock]]
[[Pop rock]][[Elke Buhr]] for [[Frankfurter Rundschau]]. [http://www.signandsight.com/features/1222.html "As if" eroticism]. February 22, 2007. English translation by Sign and Sight.com
Straightforward pop-rock with catchy melodies and a well-calculated mix of stolen Metallica riffs and romantic ballad elements. Everything is played on the safe side, and the production is technically perfect.
ABC - [http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/Story?id=5665875&page=3 Tokio Hotel: The Latest German Export]
A winning combination of lyrics laced with "emo" angst, wrapped in a flamboyant pop-rock package. It's PG-rated but still edgy enough for younger fans. Songs range from catchy pop anthems to anti-suicide messages to appealing rock ballads.

[[Powerpop]][http://www.dw-world.de/dw/article/0,2144,3626595,00.html Dw-world.de] | Length = 41:50
52:00 (2006) | Language = [[German Language|German]] | Label = [[Universal Music|Universal Germany]] | Producer = Dave Roth, David Jost, Peter Hoffmann, Pat Benzer | Reviews = | Last album = | This album = '''''Schrei'''''
(2005) | Next album = ''[[Zimmer 483]]''
(2007) | Misc = {{Singles | Name = Schrei | Type = studio recording | single 1 = [[Durch den Monsun]] | single 1 date = August 15, 2005 | single 2 = [[Schrei (song)|Schrei]] | single 2 date = November 25, 2005 | single 3 = [[Rette mich (Tokio Hotel song)|Rette mich]] | single 3 date = March 10, 2006 | single 4 = [[Der letzte Tag]] | single 4 date = August 28, 2006 }} {{Extra album cover | Type = Album | Upper caption = Schrei (so laut du kannst) | Cover = Tokio Hotel-Schrei-so laut du kannst-album.jpg | Lower caption = 2006 Re-issue }} }} '''''Schrei''''' is the [[debut album]] by the [[Germany|German]] band [[Tokio Hotel]]. In 2006, they released a partly re-recorded and expanded version, '''''Schrei - so laut du kannst'''''.{{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p745895|label=Tokio Hotel}} The album was only released in Germany, Italy, France, Canada, and Japan. The initial limited edition came with a bonus DVD including the music video for "[[Durch den Monsun]]", special making of "Durch den Monsun" feature, an Interview, and Photo Gallery. Because vocalist [[Bill Kaulitz]]'s voice changed with [[puberty]], the band re-recorded the songs "[[Schrei (song)|Schrei]]", "[[Rette Mich (Tokio Hotel song)|Rette mich]]", and "[[Der Letzte Tag]]". The version of "Schrei (so laut du kannst)" that is sold in Germany only has the re-recorded version of "Rette mich", while the version sold in France has the re-recorded versions of "Schrei," "Rette mich," "Der Letzte Tag", and acoustic versions of "Schrei" and "Durch den Monsun." "Schrei" has sold more than 1,500,000 copies worldwide while "Schrei (so laut du kannst)" has sold 100,000 copies worldwide. ==Track listing== {{tracklist | music_credits = yes | title1 = [[Schrei
